incentives.description: Specially curated lineup of speakers and entertainment during the ceremony
Tickets for guests (guest ticket amounts may differ for each graduation)
Commemorative program to remember your special day

questions.question: What do I need to submit in order to participate?
answer: Submit your 75-word personal narrative and picture in the application.

questions.question: What is required for my application?
answer: Example: I would like to thank my family and friends for their continuous support throughout my academic journey. Their encouragement and belief in me have been instrumental in helping me achieve this milestone. I am also grateful to my professors and mentors for their guidance and inspiration. This achievement is not just mine but a reflection of the collective effort and love from those around me.

questions.question: What should I wear?
questions.answer: We encourage you to wear business casual, graduation regalia, or cultural regalia.

questions.question: How many guest tickets do I get?
answer: ALL Graduations are open seating (not reserved). First come, first served. Number of guest tickets may be subject to change.

questions.question: I have more questions. Who do I contact?
questions.answer: Please email the respective center coordinator or visit the Cross Cultural Centers (CCC) located on the 2nd floor of the University-Student Union.

native.acknowledgement: I want to thank the Choctaw for continuing to provide scholarships during my academic career, my family and friends for their nonstop support in all my success.
I would love to thank my parents for supporting me during my cultural endeavors and my guidance counselors, who have gone above and beyond to ensure a smooth transition as a first-generation student.

As a Native American woman, receiving honors with a Bachelor's degree in Psychology is a momentous occasion that fills me with pride and gratitude. This journey has been shaped by the support and guidance of many individuals and communities, for which I am deeply thankful. First and foremost, I want to express my heartfelt appreciation to my friends and family. Their unwavering love, encouragement, and sacrifices have been the foundation of my academic pursuits.
Thank you to my family and friends for providing me with guidance, and motivation. I am grateful for all the support!

I first want to give glory to God because without him I would not be where I am today with all my trials and tribulations. I want to thank my family for everything and most importantly my mom for being my rock! And thank you to my extended family for being there for me.
Thank you to my wife, without you none of this is possible. To Corina you have no idea the legacy you have, love you profe. To Kim I wanna be like you when I grow up. Love you
